column17: PCN Revamp targets the core PCN lifecycle and processes across Molex sites, directly improving end-to-end change control effectiveness.
Project updates workflow, decision tree and on‑time implementation targets—directly improving execution readiness and delivery.
Revamp creates more flexible decisioning and templates, partially enabling adaptive behavior but full adaptivity needs broader rollout and governance.
Some role changes and new workflows imply training needs, but the project does not primarily deliver learning programs.
Streamlined workflow and NetWeaver integration increase scalability potential, though further platform and global rollout work remains.

column3: Proactive Product Change Control Risk Effects & Analysis
column15: Proactive Product Change Risk Effects & Analysis (L4)
column17: Improved decision tree and data visibility help detect risks earlier, but advanced risk analytics are not fully in scope.
Better workflows and supplier sync improve cross‑functional contribution, though full seamless collaboration requires additional integrations.
Enhanced CFD templates and stakeholder sync increase impact assessment capability, but deeper stakeholder tooling/analytics remain future work.
Modified CFD templates, clearer communications and focus on customer messaging are central objectives—direct, high impact.
NetWeaver alignment and a streamlined PCN workflow materially improve end‑to‑end traceability and status tracking.

column3: Shared Product Part Change Control Coordination
column15: Shared Product Part Change Control Coordination (L3)
column17: Process refinements and supplier sync reduce coordination issues for shared parts, though configuration/version controls may need further enhancements.
The project’s NetWeaver integration and planned status improvements (and later self‑service) directly increase real‑time visibility for stakeholders.
